RTCRtpScriptTransformer.summary: The RTCRtpScriptTransformer interface of the WebRTC API provides a worker-side Stream API interface that a WebRTC Encoded Transform can use to modify encoded media frames in the incoming and outgoing WebRTC pipelines.

blockquote.para: This feature is available in Dedicated Web Workers.

RTCRtpScriptTransformerReadable.summary: The readable read-only property of the interface returns a instance is a source for encoded media frames.

remarks.para:
When the corresponding is inserted into the WebRTC sender and receiver pipelines, this stream may be enqueued with outgoing or incoming encoded media frames ( or ).
A WebRTC encoded transform can read the frames, modify them as needed, and then send them back into the WebRTC pipeline by writing them to .
A common way to perform this operation is to pipe the frames through a .

RTCRtpScriptTransformerSendKeyFrameReque.summary: The sendKeyFrameRequest() method of the interface may be called by a WebRTC Encoded Transform that is processing incoming encoded video frames, in order to request a key frame from the sender.

remarks.para:
The method may only be called when receiving video (not audio) frames and if, for whatever reason, a recipient will not be able to decode the video without a new key frame.
Note that the user agent can decide that the request for a key frame is not necessary, in which case the returned promise will fulfill even though the request was not actually sent.

blockquote.para:
It might be called, for example, if a new user joins a WebRTC conference, in order to reduce the time before they receive a key frame and can hence start displaying video.
For more information see Triggering a key frame in Using WebRTC Encoded Transforms.

RTCRtpScriptTransformerSendKeyFrameReque.returns: A that fulfills with undefined once the request is sent, or the user agent decides that it does not need to.

RTCRtpScriptTransformerOptions.summary: The options read-only property of the interface returns the object that was (optionally) passed as the second argument during construction of the corresponding .

RTCRtpScriptTransformerWritable.summary: The writable read-only property of the interface returns a instance that can be used as a sink for encoded media frames enqueued on the corresponding .

remarks.para:
When the corresponding is inserted into the WebRTC sender and receiver pipelines, encoded media frames ( or ) may be enqueued on the .
A WebRTC encoded transform can read the frames from readable, modify them as needed, and then send them back into the WebRTC pipeline by sending them to this writable.
A common way to perform this operation is to pipe the frames through a .

RTCRtpScriptTransformerGenerateKeyFrame.summary: The generateKeyFrame() method of the interface causes a video encoder to generate a key frame.
RTCRtpScriptTransformerGenerateKeyFrame.returns: A that fulfills with the timestamp of the frame, or rejects with an exception value.
